poem:
Title: The Curtain Call

Beneath the cross and nomadic sky,
the same old bitter love songs to bawl;
Music, twisting passion's cry.
Moves swift, in a captivating sprawl.

An abyss of reason under starlit cloak,
echoes of Mascagni and Rachmaninov invoke,
Through notes spun of silk and smoke,
Spelling tales of hearts, tediously broke.
